snippet: New claims for unemployment benefits fell 27,000 last week, the biggest decline in about a year.
abstract: Labor Department reports new claims for state unemployment benefits fell 27,000 in the previous week to a seasonally adjusted 365,000, the biggest decline since May 2011.
lead_paragraph: New claims for unemployment benefits fell 27,000 last week, the biggest decline in about a year.

headline.seo: Jobless Claims Fall Ahead of April Employment Data
headline.main: Jobless Claims Decline Ahead of Friday’s April Employment Report
headline.print_headline: Jobless Claims Decline Ahead of Friday’s April Employment Report
